#Background
**Language family**: Iroquoian / Southern Iroquian / Cherokee

#Phonology

#Alphabet
Cherokee has both a syllabary and a Latin script. 
Latin script: 
A, a: /a/
D, d: /d/
E, e: /e/
G, g: /g/
H, h: /h/
I, i: /i/
K, k: /k/
L, l: /l/ or /ɬ/
M, m: /m/ (appears in very few native words)
N, n: /n/
O, o: /o/
Q, q: /kʰw/
S, s: /s/
T, t: /t/
U, u: /u/
V, v: /ə̃/
W, w: /ɰ/
Y, y; /j/

#Rules
/l/ > [ɬ] /t_
C[-voice -sonorant -continuant] > Cʰ/_V
